I don't have personal opinions or experiences, so i can provide you with general information.

camera angles in horror films are influential in building suspense and can have a significant impact on the audience. the angle and shot composition can be used to create a sense of discomfort, suspense, or even disorientation.

for instance, low-angle shots are often used in horror films to produce feelings of vulnerability for the audience. when a character is shot from a low angle, it gives the viewers the sense that they are looking up at the character, and this can make the figure seem larger or more intimidating. conversely, high-angle shots can make a character look smaller and more vulnerable.

another example is the use of close-ups. a close-up shot in a horror film typically shows a character's face or a particular object in detail, often making it the focal point of a scene. the closeness of the shot can make the scene feel more intense and intimidating, particularly when used alongside music or sound effects.

finally, the use of tracking or panning shots can create an unsettling feeling in the audience. when the camera follows the action, it can increase the suspense levels as the audience doesn't know what will happen next.

overall, the right camera angles in horror films play a significant role in creating suspense and tension. filmmakers use different shots to manipulate the audience's emotions, and suspenseful camera angles can make a scene terrifying even without a jump scare or gore.
